goal.ch:
“1. 使學生熟悉短篇小說寫作；
2. 使學生熟悉電影製作；
3. 提高學生說故事的能力。“
goal.en:
“1. To familiarize students with short story writing.
2. To familiarize students with film making.
3. To cultivate students’ ability of story-telling.“

outline.ch:
This course will introduce students to a variety of films adapted from short stories. Students will read both the original texts and the films closely to get a comparative perspective of the literary and cinematic art of story-telling. Other than reading short stories, students should expect to watch films in the theater and on-line, answer questions before class every week, and be active in group discussions about the literary and film texts. Other requirements include one oral report, final exam, and final project. Attendance is mandatory.
Syllabus:
Sept. 13 Introduction
Sept. 20 STRANGER THAN FICTION (2006)
Sept. 27“Bringing Up Baby”/ BRINGING UP BABY (1938)
Oct. 4 “The Killers“／THE KILLERS (1946)
Oct. 11 “The Sweet Smell of Success”/ THE SWEET SMELL OF SUCCESS (1958)
Oct. 18 The Graduate／THE GRADUATE (1968)
Oct. 25  Dan Quixote／MAN OF LAMANCHA (1972)
Nov. 1 〈母與子〉／《母親三十歲》 (1973)
Not. 8  The Shining／THE SHINING (1980)
Nov. 15  “Jerry and Molly and Sam“ / SHORTCUTS (1993)
Nov. 22Girl, Interrupted／GIRL, INTERRUPTED (1999)
Nov. 29 〈對倒〉／《花樣年華》 (2000)
Dec. 6  “Brokeback Mountain” / BROKEBACK MOUNTAIN (2005)
Dec. 13 “The Secret Life of Walter Mitty”/ THE SECRET LIFE OF WALTER MITTY (2013)
Dec. 20  “Barn Burning”/ BURING (Korean) (2018)
Dec. 27    Final Report
